name: Arum triphyllum
Relationship: Compare: Ammon. carb.; Ailanthus; Cepa. Antidotes: Buttermilk, Acet-ac.; Puls.

Eyes: Quivering of upper eyelids, especially left
Head: Bores head in pillow
Headache from too warm clothing, from hot coffee
Mouth: Tongue red, sore; whole mouth raw
Corners of mouth sore and cracked
Lips and soft palate sore and burning
Raw feeling at roof and palate
Nose: Hay-fever, with pain over root of nose
Acrid, excoriating discharge, producing raw sores
Face feels chapped, as if from cold wind; feels hot
Nose completely stopped, with fluent, acrid discharge
Constant picking at nose until it bleeds
Large scabs high up on right side of nose
Nose obstructed; must breathe through mouth
Skin: Scarlet rash; raw, bloody surfaces anywhere

details: Arum maculatum, Italicum, Dracontium, have the same action as the Triphyllum. They all contain an irritant poison, causing inflammation of mucous surfaces and destruction of tissue. ACRIDITY is the keynote of the kind of action characteristic of Arum.
